alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Nottoway; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:14PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Greensville, southeastern Nottoway, southwestern Sussex, Dinwiddie and northeastern Brunswick Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Blackstone to McKenney to near Purdy. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Dinwiddie, Emporia, Blackstone, McKenney, Purdy, Jarratt, Wilsons, Fort Barfoot, Radium, Dewitt, Spainville, North Wellville, Bufford Crossroads, Pleasant Shade, Wharfs Store, Darvills, Cowie Corner, Wellville, Dominy Corner and Hebron. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
